name: Curried Chickpea Salad
description: This dish is surprisingly good considering the ingredients are so simple, and it’s a cinch to make. It’s better to eat the same day, once you stir in the fresh herbs.
keywords: dairy-free, gluten-free, kosher, nut-free, vegan, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 4 teaspoons lemon juice, or to taste
2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro or parsley

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a sauté pan large enough to easily hold the beans over medium heat. When hot, add the oil to heat, then add the onion and sauté until deeply colored, about 6 to 8 minutes, stirring periodically.
Add the turmeric, cumin, coriander and cayenne pepper (if using) and continue to sauté until the spices are aromatic and a bit toasted, about 3 minutes.
Add the chickpeas, lemon juice, salt and pepper and cook for another 5 minutes to blend the flavors.
Remove from heat and cool. Store in the refrigerator, or mix in the fresh cilantro or parsley and serve immediately.
